definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: The wedding kiss is the sign of the holy pledge between the bride and the groom.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮上的親吻標誌着新郎新娘間的神聖誓約。

sentences.english: Silver, gold and platinum cards denote wealth classes.
sentences.chinese: 銀卡，金卡和白金卡標誌着不同的財富階層。

sentences.english: Gray-matter maturity, however, does not signal the end of mental change.
sentences.chinese: 然而灰質的成熟並不標誌着智力變換的終結。

sentences.english: A: There’s a sign that says NO PARKING.
sentences.chinese: 那裏有塊“禁止停車”的標誌牌。

sentences.english: All rights to the Olympic symbol belong exclusively to the IOC.
sentences.chinese: 奧林匹克標誌的所有權屬國際奧委會專有。

sentences.english: A clean house is a sign of a misspent life.
sentences.chinese: 一間乾淨的房子是一個浪費的人生的標誌。

sentences.english: This was a mark of great shame and disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 這在當時是恥辱與不光彩的標誌。
我必須在把這些標誌換過來。

sentences.english: But theorists hold different viewpoints on the origin of historical materialism.
sentences.chinese: 但學術界在唯物史觀誕生標誌問題上，一直都有分歧。

sentences.english: Itsymbolizes one kind of ideal boundary of the language curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 它標誌着語文課程的一種理想境界。

sentences.english: The logo must incorporate both the Chinese characters and the English name of the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 該標誌必須包含兩個漢字和餐廳的英文名稱。

sentences.english: Please note that the product label bears the Clariant mark as shown in the above sample.
sentences.chinese: 請注意產品標籤上的科萊恩標誌，如上圖樣本所示。

sentences.english: Never to master one's anger is a mark of intemperance and lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 不能剋制怒氣是任性和缺乏教養的標誌。

sentences.english: The staff with the snake has long been a symbol of medicine and the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，由蛇盤繞的權杖系醫學及醫學界的標誌。

sentences.english: The risk is that higher headline inflation is misinterpreted as a sign that policy is too loose.
sentences.chinese: 真正的風險是高整體通脹被誤解讀成政策寬鬆的標誌。

sentences.english: Okay what is the argument word in this one?
sentences.chinese: 好，這裏什麼是論點的標誌詞呢？

definition: variant of 標誌|标志[biao1 zhi4]
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
